parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandatory for campaign materials in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly refers to Brian Cristian, who is identified as a deputy and a candidate.  The text mentions his legislative initiatives (277) and 10 promulgated laws, clearly linking his actions to his role as a parliamentarian. The URL www.briancristian.ro further reinforces this connection. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience.  The use of a paid platform and the general message ("România pentru toți, nu doar pentru unii!") indicate an attempt to address the public at large. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to positively influence voters' perception of Brian Cristian. Highlighting his legislative achievements and urging voters to "inform themselves correctly" before choosing their parliamentarians directly encourages support for his candidacy. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post presents information about Brian Cristian's work, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. The focus is on promoting his achievements and implicitly encouraging votes, rather than providing balanced information. It does not adhere to journalistic standards.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted message designed to promote a candidate's image and influence voting behavior. The language used is promotional, not expressive of personal views.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1244156820201582</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Brian Cristian), is clearly intended for a wide audience (paid Facebook ad), has an explicit electoral objective (positive portrayal to influence votes), and does not adhere to journalistic standards. The presence of a CMF number further confirms its nature as campaign material.  The post's timing (after the official campaign period) is also a crucial factor.  While the exact end date of the campaign is not specified, the context strongly suggests a violation if the post was published after the legal deadline.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR Maramures</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 1244156820201582), cu conținut electoral care promovează candidatul Brian Cristian, evidențiind realizările sale legislative (277 inițiative, 10 legi promulgate) și îndemnând alegătorii să se informeze corect înainte de a-și alege parlamentarii.  Postarea, care a beneficiat de o investiție financiară de sub 100 RON, a avut o estimare a audienței de 100.000 - 500.000 de persoane,  și conține numărul CMF 11240015, fapt ce confirmă caracterul său de material electoral.  Efectul electoral al postării este clar pozitiv pentru Brian Cristian, având ca obiectiv influențarea votului în favoarea sa.  Informațiile de contact ale USR Maramureș sunt disponibile la maramures@usrmm.ro și +40751926939.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
